class result_analysis.tests.test_charting.Test(methodName='runTest')¶

Bases: unittest.case.TestCase

assert_dataframes_equal(df1, df2)¶
assert_heatmaps_equal(fig, truth_arr, col_names=None)¶

Assert whether the data in a given matplotlib figure is the same as the data in a different matplotlib figure that was previously saved.

For additional thoroughness, pass in the array of column names of the previously saved figure.

Uses self.assertEqual().

Parameters

  • fig (matplotlib.pyplot.Figure) – figure whose data is to be tested for equality against the data of a previously saved figure

  • truth_arr (np.array) – the data extracted from the reference figure

  • col_names ([str]) – optionally, the column names of the figures’ columns

:raise AssertionError

np_diff(first, second, as_df=False)¶

Given two numpy arrays, return a ‘diff’ array of shape (n, 2) in which each row is one of n differences. Col 0 is value in the first array, and col 1 is value in the second array.

if as_df is True, returns a dataframe with column header [‘first’, ‘second’]

Parameters

  • first (np.array) – one np array to compare

  • second (np.array) – other np array to compare

:returns an np array with result, or a dataframe :rtype {np.array | pd.DataFrame}
